intro: Stellarioides flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green starwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It features small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its flowering stems are usually branched and can reach heights of up to 15 centimeters. Stellarioides flavovirens is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
